title: Holidays and Traditions

vocab.definition: A special day when people celebrate something important
Something special that families do year after year
To do fun things on a special day
Different from other days; important and meaningful
The special day each year when you were born
People who live together and care for each other

teachingNotes: Discuss various cultural holidays respectfully. Share family traditions. Create classroom celebrations for learning.

sample.question: What do people do on their birthday?
What do families do on Thanksgiving?
How do people celebrate New Year?
What special foods do families eat on holidays?

truefalse.question: Different families celebrate different holidays.
expectedAny: families have different traditions and holidays

truefalse.question: All holidays are on the same day every year.
Traditions help families remember special things.
Only adults can start new traditions.
Holidays are always about having fun.
expectedAny: holidays are for celebrating and fun

truefalse.question: Every family celebrates holidays the same way.
Special days help bring people together.

multiplechoice.question: What makes a day a holiday?

expectedAny: Valentine's Day is for giving cards and love

multiplechoice.question: When do people usually give thanks?

expectedAny: Halloween is for trick or treating

multiplechoice.question: What helps families remember their traditions?

expectedAny: New Year is for making resolutions

multiplechoice.question: What do traditions help us do?

wordProblems.question: Maria's family celebrates 4 holidays in winter and 3 holidays in summer. How many holidays do they celebrate total?
For his birthday party, Jake invited 8 friends. If 2 friends couldn't come, how many friends came to the party?
On Halloween, Emma got 12 pieces of candy from trick-or-treating. She ate 5 pieces. How many pieces does she have left?
The class is making 15 Valentine's cards. They finished 9 cards yesterday. How many more cards do they need to make?
Thanksgiving dinner has 6 adults and 4 children. How many people are at dinner?
For the New Year party, there are 20 balloons. If 5 balloons pop, how many balloons are left?
Sarah made 8 holiday cookies on Monday and 7 more on Tuesday. How many cookies did she make total?
